intro: Nasa sagasteguii, commonly known as the Peruvian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Peru. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool and sunny conditions. Its botanical name honors the Peruvian botanist José Sagastegui, who contributed significantly to the study of native flora. Nasa sagasteguii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
